timeline.message:
Introduce EventTrackerStatusChangeListener

Introduce the EventTrackerStatusChangeListener which users will be able
to specify to react to changes in the EventTrackerStatus. They'll
receive a Map of segmentId to EventTrackerStatus if a change occurred.
Additionally, on the interface they can define if they want to react on
updated tracker positions. By default it wont, as those happen often and
 thus would typically not be valuable.

#1338

Add matching functions to the EventTrackerStatus

The EventTrackerStatusChangeListener should react when
EventTrackerStatus' are different. To that end a mechanism should be
included to detect differences, which may or may not include positions
validation.

#1338

Include special case TrackerStatus objects

To be able to detect new or removed EventTrackerStatus objects which as
such can be passed to the EventTrackerStatusChangeListener, providing
special case implementations is beneficial. These special cases are
regarded as wrappers to a new/removed actual EventTrackerStatus
implementation.

#1338

Allow configuration of the EventTrackerStatusChangeListener

The TrackingEventProcessorConfiguration should provide methods to
configure and retrieve a EventTrackerStatusChangeListener instance. It
should default to a no-op implementation.

#1338

Wrap every status update to check for changes

All occurrences of an update to the activeSegments should be wrapped. If
 there's a change between the old set and the new set, whether that's an
 addition, removal or changes (with or without positions taken into
 account), the EventTrackerStatusChangeListener should be invoked with
 the adjustments.

#1338

Use is not empty instead of size check

Use is not empty instead of size check to match removed or added
segments

replies.bodyText:
I intended to embrace the special case pattern, which my gut told me would work best with dedicated objects.
I even played with the idea of wrapping the entire collection containing all the status objects, so that it's the collection which knows when something is added, removed or updated. That became rather ugly, rather quickly though, so I abandoned that for the time being.
But, what do you think, should we move away from this special case pattern here?
replies.author: smcvb

replies.bodyText: We had a think and chat about it. Adding default methods which state whether an EventTrackerStatus was added or removed make the API within the EventTrackerStatusChangeListener a lot more friendly, as no instanceof checks or casts would ever be needed. We thus deduced to introduce these methods to promote a nicer API.
replies.author: smcvb

timeline.message:
Provide overloaded isDifferent method

Providing an overloaded isDifferent method which defaults to take
positions into account makes the API somewhat clearer to deal with

#1338

Introduce methods denominating EventTrackerStatus as added/removed

The requirement to cast or verify an EventTrackerStatus as being an
AddedTrackerStatus or RemovedTrackerStatus isn't very user friendly.
Having a dedicated method for this, which both default to false on the
main interface is a lot easier to use.
